title: bao_(vtuber)_(5th_costume)
body:
The 5th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of the [[indie virtual youtuber|Indie]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] [[Bao (vtuber)|]], referred to as her "lemon" costume and used for her original song "Citrus Love":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xSsWP2DPSQU]

It consists of an [[orange sweater|orange]] [[cropped sweater]], a [[white skirt|white]] or [[orange skirt]] (inconsistently depicted between the MV/album art and the actual model), a pair of [[white boots|white]] [[high heel boots]] with [[orange socks]], and a [[white choker]]. She also wears a [[black headwear|black]] [[beret]] an a [[single earring|single]] [[lemon slice]] [[earrings|earring]] on her left ear.

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] in this costume, she has [[short hair]] with [[blonde hair|blonde]] [[streaked hair|streaks]], and her tail is colored orange to match the outfit.

h4. Appearance

* !post #5952619: Profile
* !post #5776057: Merchandise

title: bao_(vtuber)_(3rd_costume)
body:
The 3rd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of the [[indie virtual youtuber|Indie]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] [[Bao (vtuber)|]], referred to as her "winter" costume and was released on Valentines Day 2022.

It consists of a [[fur-trimmed capelet|fur-trimmed]] [[white capelet]] over a thick [[white dress]]. Underneath the winterwear is a lighter [[white dress]] with [[strap]]s, and further underneath that dress is a [[blue dress|blue]] [[strapless dress]]. In each variation she wears a [[blue bow]] on her neck, a single [[thigh strap]], and a pair of [[white shoes|white]] [[high heels]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] in this look, she has her [[very long hair|very ]] [[ponytail]], adorned with a [[white bow|hair bow]]. This outfit was the first to depict Bao with a [[cetacean tail|whale tail]], and was later updated to allow her to change colors, swapping her [[pink eyes]], [[pink hair|hair]], [[pink bow|bow]], light [[pink dress|dress]], and tail to pink.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #19759854: Profile

title: vienna_(vtuber)_(2nd_costume)
body:
The 2nd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of the [[indie virtual youtuber|Indie]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] [[Vienna (vtuber)|]], released for her first anniversary.

This attire consists of a [[white dress|white]] [[off-shoulder dress]] with a pair of [[white sandals|white]] [[gladiator sandals]], a [[thigh strap]], a [[white choker]], and a [[necklace]].

In this look, Vienna has [[pink hair]] with a [[white ribbon|white]] [[hair ribbon]]. It is also the first costume to depict her with a [[dragon tail]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #5361277: Profile
* !post #5366101: Reference sheet

title: ai-chan_(honkai_impact)
body:
A [[Honkai Impact 3rd]] character. Known as Self-Regulatory Unit A1, she acts as your in-game assistant guiding you through many different aspects of the game. Voiced by [[Horie Yui]] in Japanese. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[green hair]] tied into [[double bun]]s, and [[orange eyes]]. Her outfit consists of a [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[layered dress]] ([[black dress|black]] outer and [[white dress|white]] inner) with a [[green bowtie]], [[red gloves|red]] [[elbow gloves]], [[white pantyhose]], green [[anklet]]s, and [[white shoes]]. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #5365283

h4. See also

* [[Naoe Kanetsugu (honkai_impact)|]]
* [[Discipline Enforcer A1]]

title: gaulem_(kyokugen_dasshutsu)
body:
A GAULEM ([b]G[/b]eneral-purpose [b]AU[/b]tonomous-Control [b]L[/b]abor [b]E[/b]lectronic [b]M[/b]achine) is a kind of [[humanoid robot]] in [[Kyokugen Dasshutsu ADV: Zennin Shibou Desu]]. 

Two notable GAULEMs include GOL-M, who serves as a supporting character in the game's "GAULEM Bay" escape room segment, and [spoiler][[Luna (kyokugen dasshutsu)|]], who is an [[android]] modeled after [[Diana (kyokugen dasshutsu)|]].[/spoiler]

h4. External links
* "Zero Escape Wiki: GAULEM":[https://zeroescape.fandom.com/wiki/GAULEM]
* "Zero Escape Wiki: GOL-M":[https://zeroescape.fandom.com/wiki/G-OLM]

title: elmo_training_outfit
body:
The outfit the Dolls wear in the [[Elmo (vehicle)|]] during training in [[Girls' Frontline 2: Exilium]]. In pre-release material, some in-game CGs, and some emote stamps, the outfit was originally depicted as more color-coded, before becoming more consistently grey by release with limited color-coded.

Alongside appearing in fanart for Dolls which have appeared in the game, it is popular to depict Dolls that have yet to appear from elsewhere in the series wearing it.

title: jiangyu_(neural_cloud)
body:
An Agent in [[Girls' Frontline Neural Cloud]]. A Performer Doll developed by Cyber Media, a past instance of [[Type 97 (girls' frontline)|]] and sister of [[Daiyan (Neural Cloud)|]].

Jiangyu has very [[very long hair|very long]] [[black hair]] in [[twintails]] and [[red eyes]]. Her normal costume consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[crop top]] with a [[detached collar]], a [[red necktie]] and [[black straps]] framing a [[see-through shirt]], black [[detached sleeves]], [[black shorts|black]] [[short shorts]], [[white thighhighs|white]] [[thighhighs]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]], as well as [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]]. When compared to Type 97 in the original [[Girls' Frontline]], she has almost the same appearance save for the skirt being shorts and her [[midriff]] being visible.

As a result of Jiangyu's Live2D artist posting a non-official "animation":[/posts/5995283] of her doing a [[fellatio gesture]], paired with her outfit, she's often rendered in a lewd fashion in fanart.

h4. Appearance

* !post #7219583: 5* Default

h4. Skins

* !post #7219582: [[Jiangyu (Angler's Sweep) (neural cloud)|Angler's Sweep]]
* !post #7219581: Blushing Afterglow
* !post #8061448: Scintillating Ripples

h4. See also

* [[list_of_girls'_frontline_characters#RC|List of Girls' Frontline Neural Cloud characters]]

h4. External links

* "IOP Wiki: Jiangyu":[https://iopwiki.com/wiki/Jiangyu]

title: eos_(neural_cloud)
body:
Eos is a female character from the game [[Girls' Frontline Neural Cloud]].

Eos was a Greater Sanctifier of the Reverse Tower of Babylon.  She was created at the same time as [[lord eosphoros (neural cloud)|Eosphoros]] as a complementary counterpart to him.  As Eos and Eosphoros were created from the same template, [[Antonina (neural cloud)|]] describes them as something akin to twins. Before the events of the game she was registered as KIA.

Prior to her release as a playable Agent during the Entropic Dichotomy event, she first appears in the game as a disguise form taken on by Eosphoros.

h4. Skins

title: hannah_(neural_cloud)
body:
A female AI character from [[Girls' Frontline Neural Cloud]]. She is an agent (AI) developed in 42Lab's Rossum Sector by the agent [[Turing (neural cloud)|]]. She's initially a non-playable character, but was added to the roster of playable characters with the Critical Cascade story event.

Under Turing's care she was created and raised, and thus viewed Turing as a mother figure.

h4. Appearance

title: turing_(neural_cloud)
body:
A female AI character from [[Girls' Frontline Neural Cloud]]. She is an agent (AI) developed by 42Lab to administrate their AI development sector "Rossum." She's initially a non-playable character, but was added to the roster of playable characters with the Critical Cascade story event.

Her research lead to the creation of the AI agent [[Hannah (Neural Cloud)|]], who she treated like a daughter [spoiler]until her reset and loss of memories of the past[/spoiler].

title: makiatto_(girls'_frontline_2)
body:
An android imprinted with [[Walther WA 2000]] [[sniper rifle]] in [[Girls' Frontline 2: Exilium]], [[wa2000 (girls' frontline)|returning]] from the [[Girls' Frontline|first game]]. Voiced by [[Tomatsu Haruka]].

Her name in Chinese is rendered as '玛绮朵', as opposed to '玛奇朵' (Macchiato), with 绮 (which can mean 'beautiful, gorgeous' while pronounced like 奇) added. This would originally be romanized as Macqiato, before being changed to Makiatto prior to her release on Global.

title: yoshizawa_kasumi
body:
Character in [[Persona 5 The Royal]]. Voiced by [[Amamiya Sora]] (JP) / [[Laura Post]] (EN).

A first year student at Shuujin Academy and an accomplished gymnast, transferring to the school at the same time as [[Amamiya Ren|the protagonist]].

[spoilers]She is actually [[Yoshizawa Sumire|Sumire]], Kasumi's younger sister, living as her due to the efforts of [[Maruki Takuto]]. [[yoshizawa kasumi's sister|Kasumi herself]] died in a car accident from protecting Sumire prior to the events of the game.
For tagging purposes, this tag only applies to the party member and [i]not[/i] the real Kasumi.[/spoilers]

body:

A third-year high school student who is Student Council President of Shujin Academy. She is a strait-laced honor student, but has some suppressed anger. Her initial Persona is [[Joanna (Persona 5)|]].

Wears a [[backless outfit|backless]] [[black vest|black]] [[halterneck]] [[vest]] over her [[white shirt|white]] [[shuujin academy school uniform|uniform]] [[turtleneck]], though it is often misdrawn due to confusion about the [[overalls]]-style buckles on the neck strap.

title: takamaki_anne
body:
[[Persona 5]] character. Voiced by [[Mizuki Nana]] (JP) / [[Erika Harlacher]] (EN).

A 16-year-old, quarter-American girl who attends Shujin High School. Unable to fit in with those around her due to her noticeably different appearance, she isolates herself within the school. She is often seen hanging out with the [[amamiya ren|protagonist]] and [[Sakamoto Ryuuji]]. Strange rumors about her have seemingly been circulating the school, but whether or not they’re true is currently unknown. Her initial persona is [[Carmen (Persona 5)|]].

title: princess_royale
body:
An illustration contest, themed on battle heroines in mythologies and fairy tales, held by Pixiv and 2.5-Jigen TV internet television company from October to November 2012. 

The contest ran from October 11 to November 28, 2012. Entries were tagged with プリンセスロワイヤルイラストコンテスト. The goal was to "draw an original fairy tale or mythologically-themed heroine in a modern, fantasy, or even science fiction setting. For a given character, multiple winners could be selected.

Like many Pixiv contests, non-winning entries were often taken down by artists after the contest period ended, leaving Danbooru and similar archive sites as one of the only places preserving the works.

h4. Contest Results

Contest results were announced on 2012-12-19. There were 3068 people who entered. Winners received a "2.5 Dimension TV Award", which meant ¥50,000 prize money. While the original announcement said 20 or more winners would be selected, in fact 50 winners were selected:

title: help:bur_notice
body:
A [b]bulk update request[/b] (BUR) is a request to change one or more tags. Creating a bulk update request will create a forum topic to discuss and vote on the request.

Use the format below to make a request:

[code]
alias bunny_tail -> rabbit_tail
unalias bunny_tail -> rabbit_tail

imply rabbit_tail -> tail
unimply rabbit_tail -> tail

rename bunny_tail -> rabbit_tail

update bunny solo no_humans -> animal_focus

deprecate orange
undeprecate orange

nuke bunny

category touhou -> copyright
[/code]

[b]Alias[/b] merges two tags, making the first tag a synonym for the second tag. Aliasing [[bunny tail]] to [[rabbit tail]] moves all [[bunny tail]] posts to [[rabbit tail]], and redirects all searches for [[bunny tail]] to [[rabbit tail]].

[b]Imply[/b] makes the first tag automatically add the second tag. Implying [[bunny tail]] to [[tail]] means all [[bunny tail]] posts are automatically tagged with the [[tail]] tag. Both tags must be in the same category.

[b]Rename[/b] renames a tag without making it a permanent alias. Renaming [[bunny tail]] to [[rabbit tail]] moves all [[bunny tail]] posts to [[rabbit tail]], but doesn't redirect searches for [[bunny tail]] to [[rabbit tail]]. Most tag moves should be aliases, not renames. Renames are for when a permanent alias would be undesirable. Tags with more than 200 posts can't be renamed, they must be aliased.

[b]Update[/b] does a mass search and add. The tags on the left are searched and the tags on the right are added to all matching posts. Tags can also be removed by prepending [code]-[/code] to the tag on the right. Aliases and implications automatically adjust post tags upon creation, so mass updates are not necessary in those cases.

[b]Deprecate[/b] locks the tag so it can't be added to posts. [b]Undeprecate[/b] reverts this.

[b]Nuke[/b] removes a tag or pool.

[b]Category[/b] changes the tag to an artist, copyright, character, general, or meta tag. It can be used to propose changing the category of a tag with many posts that [[help:tags#Changing tag categories|you cannot do yourself]], or to change the tag category after other types of changes are made.

title: plateau
body: A flat-topped area sharply raised above a lower area by the earth, typically with a very steep incline.

title: triangular_anus
body:
A [[deformed anus]] that is relaxed or [[gaping]] and shaped like a triangle, typically [[after anal]] intercourse.

h4. See also

* [[anus]]
* [[gaping]]
* [[spread anus]]
* [[after anal]]

title: vertical_anus
body:
A [[deformed anus]] that is relaxed or only slightly [[gaping]], and shaped like a vertical line.

This is typically seen in characters whose anuses have undergone sexual development through prolonged and repeated [[anal objection insertion|anal insertion]], such as anal [[masturbation]] or [[anal]] sex.

If the anus has been [[spreading own anus|spread]] horizontally and taken on a horizontal shape, do not use this tag.

h4. See also

* [[anus]]
* [[presenting anus]]

title: baalia_(neural_cloud)
body:
Avatar of [[Girls' Frontline Neural Cloud]] Producer Kamie, introduced in the February 5th 2021 Beilan Island Shelter Broadcast as a result of needing a Live2D avatar for those devlogs.

Supposedly designed in reference to the second character in Kamie's name (咩, miē), as it can be read as the bleating of a sheep or goat, so they designed a well-endowed goat-demon girl, dubbed Kamiēzǐ (卡咩子), otherwise transcribed by fans as Kamieko. In the non-Chinese versions of the game, her name gets localized as Memeko in Japanese and Korean, and Baalia in English.

Notably appears in-game as the Baalia Training Machine as part of the EXP Collection stages, and as the cause behind the events of the April Fools' "Fool's Duality" event.

h4. See also

* [[list_of_girls'_frontline_characters#RC|List of Girls' Frontline Neural Cloud characters]]

h4. External links

* "IOP Wiki: Baalia":[https://iopwiki.com/wiki/Baalia]

title: lilo_&_stitch
body:
[i]Lilo & Stitch[/i] is a [[Disney]] franchise comprising of multiple films and television series. The critical and commercial success of the 2002 animated film of the same name written and directed by Chris Sanders and Dean DeBlois was an outlier among the films of The Walt Disney Company's feature animation studio during the first half of the 2000s, during which the studio wasn't doing so well as they were compared to the 1990s (the Disney Renaissance) or the 2010s (the Disney Revival). The franchise has seen three sequel films, three different TV series, a live action remake, and various other media and merchandise, most of which put a greater focus on alien protagonist Stitch.

h4. Characters

* [[Lilo Pelekai]]
* [[Stitch (Lilo & Stitch)|]]
* [[Nani Pelekai]]
* [[Jumba]]
* [[Pleakley]]
* [[Cobra Bubbles]]
* [[Sparky (Lilo & Stitch)|]]
* [[Reuben (Lilo & Stitch)|]]
* [[Angel (Lilo & Stitch)|]]
* [[Lifeguard (Lilo & Stitch)|]]

h4. See also

* [[Leroy & Stitch]] - The fourth and final feature film in the franchise
* [[Lilo & Stitch: The Series]] - The first TV series in the franchise
* [[Stitch!]] - An anime spin-off; the second TV series in the franchise
* [[Lilo & Stitch (2025)]] - A live action remake of the original film

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Lilo & Stitch":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lilo_&_Stitch]
* "Wikipedia: Lilo & Stitch (franchise)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lilo_&_Stitch_(franchise)]
other_names: リロ・アンド・スティッチ

title: dushevnaya_(girls'_frontline_2)
body:
An android imprinted with [[KSVK 12.7]] [[anti-materiel rifle]] in [[Girls' Frontline 2: Exilium]], [[ksvk (girls' frontline)|returning]] from the [[Girls' Frontline|first game]]. Voiced by Oozeki Eri.

Originally rendered "Душевный" (Duševnyj/Dushevnyy) on Chinese servers prior to GFL2 (which was a word, not a name, something corrected in the foreign servers as "Душевная" or Dushevnaya), her name roughly means "Soulful".

Badly damaged during the time gap between GFL1 and GFL2, Dushevnaya was rescued by [[Suomi (girls' frontline 2)|]] during the GFL2 event [i]Sojourners of the Glass Island[/i], and repaired with what parts were available to the Doll Community, a group of independent dolls. Due to this, her body now has a much more mechanical appearance and she lost her memories of her time at Griffin & Kryuger. She later formally joins as a member of the Doll Community.

h4. Appearance

* !post #9022583: [[Elmo Dormitory Outfit|Dormitory]] (with [[Suomi (girls' frontline 2)|]])

title: samus_aran
body:
The main protagonist of the [[Metroid]] series. A Bounty Hunter that has averted countless crises that have threatened the galaxy, such as those involving the [[Metroid (creature)|]]s, [[Phazon]] and the [[X Parasite]]s.

Adopted by the [[Chozo]] after being orphaned by a [[Space Pirate (metroid)|]] raid, she was infused with their [[alien]] DNA and raised as a warrior. She later served under Commanding Officer [[Adam Malkovich]] within the Galactic Federation Army, but after a traumatic incident she left to become an independent Bounty Hunter.

She is armed with a Chozo [[power armor|cybernetic exoskeleton]] equipped with an [[Arm Cannon]] and a [[assault_visor|visor]] known as the [[power suit (metroid)|Power Suit]] that protects her and greatly enhances her abilities. This suit also has the means to assimilate other technology within itself to [[power-up|upgrade]] it's capabilities and gain greater power. She wears the [[Zero Suit]] under it in case of a malfunction which offers far less protection and only has her armed with the [[Paralyzer]].

According to the [[metroid_2:_return_of_samus|Metroid II]] manual and concept art for [[Super Metroid]] within her power suit she is 6'3" (1.90 m) [tn]"[1]":[http://metroid.retropixel.net/gallery.php?gallery_id=m2_manual&image_id=8][/tn][tn]"[2]":[https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/metroid/images/c/c1/M3_Kraid_design.png/][/tn]. 

h4. Default appearances

title: snare
body:
A simple device used for capturing wild [[animal]]s. It consists of a [[noose]] or loop, typically made of [[wire]], [[cable]], or strong cord.

The noose is set along a path where an animal is expected to travel (like a game trail). When the animal passes through the loop, the noose tightens around its neck or a limb, holding it in place until the trapper arrives.

title: noclip
body:
The act of clipping through objects, walls or terrain as if they are not present. Commonly seen in games as a cheating or debugging tool, see "noclip mode":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glossary_of_video_game_terms#noclip_mode

Different from [[through wall]], where there is an explanation for the behavior (i.e. the subject may be a [[ghost]], there may be a hole in the wall), with [[noclip]] the existence of the clipped-through object is entirely ignored.

Not to be confused with [[glitch]], which applies to visual artifacts, not the behavior of characters or objects.

h4. See also
* [[intangible]]
* [[surreal]]

title: intangible
body:
When an object or person is shown to not be interacting with matter that they otherwise should be under normal cirumstances (ie. going through walls, ceilings, or floors as if they weren't there).

h4. See also

* [[noclip]]
* [[through wall]]

body:

title: psycho_plates
body:
Remote controlled Newtype weapons used by the [[Moon Gundam (mobile Suit)|]], inherited from the MRX-013-3 [[Psycho Gundam Mk-IV G-Doors]], these plates can be used as ramming weapons or as shields and are mounted on the backpack when not in use, unlike [[Funnels (gundam)|]] or Bits, they don't fire beams but as a tradeoff they are extremely durable.
The G-Doors was equipped with 16 Psycho Plates before its destruction while the Moon Gundam inherited half of them.

title: satogahama_school_uniform
body:
The school uniform worn by students of Satogahama High School in [[Hachigatsu No Cinderella Nine]].

The [[summer uniform]] consists of a [[white shirt]] with [[short sleeves]], a [[white sailor collar]], a colored [[necktie]], a [[grey skirt|grey]] (dark [[blue skirt|blue]]) [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[pleated skirt]]. The most notable feature of this [[serafuku]] is [[no dickey|the absence of a chest part]].

The [[winter uniform]] consists of a [[black jacket|black]] [[blazer]], a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]] with [[long sleeves]], a colored [[neck ribbon]], a [[grey skirt|grey]] (dark [[blue skirt|blue]]) [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[pleated skirt]].

The colors of the necktie for summer uniforms and the neck ribbon for winter uniforms are as follows: blue for third-year students, yellow for second-year students, green for first-year students, and red for graduates.

title: milking_machine
body:
A device designed to extract milk from animals or people. The devices use cylinders or cups placed over the teat and then uses suction to induce [[lactation]]. 

Devices designed to extract milk for a lactating woman are called "[[breast pump]]s," and may be manual or automatic.  Devices designed to extract milk from animals, particularly diary cows, are called "milking machines," and are automatic.

title: hiroshimaben
body:
A Japanese dialect spoken in the western parts of [[Hiroshima]] Prefecture. Usually considered the stereotypical [[Yakuza]] dialect.

Heavily features the usage of じゃ (ja) as copula instead of だ (da) in Standard Japanese. Prefers のう (nou) as the sentence-final emphatic particle (instead of Standard Japanese "yo" or "ne"), and shortens から (kara) to け ("ke", often elongated to "kee"). "Jakee" will also pop up in place of the standard "dakara" (this can sometimes be deceptive as it can also have a different nuance).  

Female speakers will often use "uchi" as a first-person 'pronoun'. Male speakers will sometimes use "washi".

"Gaijin" foreigner characters are sometimes also given this accent. The usual justification is almost invariably "this character learned Japanese by watching Yakuza films".

On Danbooru, the Hiroshima dialect is sometimes adapted into a "West Country":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/West_Country_English] accent.

h4. Notable characters who speak Hiroshima dialect

* [[Aoba Kazane]] ([[Keijo!!!!!!!!]])
* [[Fuka Reventon]] ([[Vivid Strike!]])
* [[Kabuto Daigo]] ([[Idolmaster Side-M]])
* [[Kirishima Haruto]] ([[Kimi no Iru Machi]])
* [[Murakami Tomoe]] ([[Idolmaster Cinderella Girls]])
* [[Natasha (sekai seifuku)|]] ([[Sekai Seifuku: Bouryaku no Zvezda]])
* [[Nisshin (kancolle)|]] ([[Kantai Collection]]) (Nisshin's variant is unusual as she also mixes in syntax and words from [[Ye Olde Zipangese]], the Japanese equivalent of a faux-Shakespearean stage dialect)
* [[Pom-Pom (honkai: star rail)|]] ([[Honkai: Star Rail]], JP voicelines)
* [[Sakazuki (one piece)|]] ([[One Piece]])
* [[Sasano Ichigo]] ([[Saki Achiga-hen]])
* [[Someya Mako]] ([[Saki (manga)|]])
* [[Stella (arakawa)|]] ([[Arakawa Under the Bridge]])
* [[Urakaze (kancolle)|]] ([[Kantai Collection]])
* [[Wilhelmina Braunschweig Ingenohl Friedeburg]] ([[High School Fleet]]) 

h4. Other notable examples

* [[Ryuu ga Gotoku 6]] (Significant parts of the story are set in the city of Onomichi, Hiroshima Prefecture, where practically everybody speaks the Hiroshima dialect)

h4. See also

* [[Tag group:Japanese dialects]]

body:

"Source":[https://nightshade.cs.uchicago.edu/whatis.html]

title: high-low_dress
body:

If dress has a straight hemline but the character is wearing a skirt the skirt leaves the front completely open and only covers the sides and rear on top of the dress use [[dress]] + [[overskirt]] instead.

[[Skirt hold]], [[dress lift]] or [[side slit]] can create the illusion of a high-low dress, please be careful so as not to mistag.

title: holding_dress
body:
Ambiguous tag, use one of the following instead:

* [[holding unworn dress]] - When a character is holding a dress that is not being worn.
* [[dress grab]] - When a character is grabbing at their dress with one or both hands.
* [[dress lift]] - When a dress is being lifted in a sexual or revealing way, such as to expose underwear, genitalia, or ass.
* [[dress pull]] - When a dress is being pulled down in a revealing way, such as to expose skin or breasts.
* [[dress tug]] - When a character is tugging down the hem of their dress to try to avoid exposing themselves.
* [[skirt basket]] - When a skirt or dress is held up to form a basket to carry something.
* [[skirt hold]] - When a character is holding or gently lifting the skirt of their dress, but not in a lewd or revealing way.

title: smug
body:
Exhibiting or feeling great or offensive satisfaction with oneself or with one's situation (dictionary definition).

The exhibitor will always have a [[light smile]] or [[smirk]] and may have their [[crossed arms|arms crossed]] in front of them.  Also in general they will have slightly closed eyes, but fully [[closed eyes]] is very possible as well.

For the fighting game player, see [[Smug (gamer)]].

h4. See also
* [[c:]]
* [[doyagao]]
* [[smirk]]
* [[ojou-sama_pose]]
* [[Tag group:Face tags]]

title: doyagao
body:
Doya-gao (ドヤ顔) is a facial expression conveying a self-satisfied, cocky, or [[smug]] attitude. To enhance the comedy effect, one may use this expression on a character who is overly proud of something they failed at, or that they have no reason to be proud of.

Doya probably comes from Kansai Japanese "Dou ya?" meaning asking someone "How about that?" or "How well am I doing?". The phrase carries an inside meaning of "I looked cool just now, didn't I?"

A few trademarks of doyagao are a cocky expression, featuring a tight [[closed mouth|closed-lip]] [[smile]], [[closed eyes|closed]] or [[sparkling eyes]], [[v-shaped eyebrows]], and a proud [[puff of air|huff]], along with [[hands on own hips|hands on one's hips]] or chest, and a general air of "I totally nailed it just now", when the character didn't nail it at all.

h4. Examples
* !post #9412752: [[v-shaped eyebrows]] and  [[puff of air]]
* !post #9179139: v-shaped eyebrows, [[closed eyes]],  [[:3]], [[hands on own hips]] and doyaa(ドヤァ) writing
* !post #9338194: closed eyes, [[c:]]

h4. See also

* [[smirk]]
* [[smug]]
* [[troll face]]
* [[Tag group:Face tags]]
* [[>:)]]

h4. External links

* "Pixipedia: どや顔":http://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E3%81%A9%E3%82%84%E9%A1%94
* "PixiVision article":https://www.pixivision.net/en/a/2807
* "Urban Dictionary: Doya-gao":https://www.urbandictionary.com/define.php?term=doya-gao

body:
[b]Senpai ga Uzai Kouhai no Hanashi[/b] (先輩がうざい後輩の話, lit. [i]Story of a Kouhai Annoyed by Her Senpai[/i]) is a slice-of-life office comedy webcomic by [[Shiromanta]].

Initially serialized as webcomic in 2017 (pool #12918), Ichijinsha began publishing the work in print in 2018. Seven Seas Entertainment has licensed the English version and is publishing it under the title "My Senpai is Annoying". It received an anime adaptation in Fall 2021.

title: mission:_impossible
body:
An American multimedia franchise based on a fictional secret espionage agency known as the Impossible Missions Force (IMF). It began as a CBS television show created by Bruce Geller that aired from 1966 to 1973 and was later revived on ABC with a new cast of characters which aired from 1988 to 1990.

Beginning in 1996, it also included a series of action spy films starring [[Tom Cruise]] as IMF agent Ethan Hunt. There have been eight [i]Mission: Impossible[/i] films thus far, with the latest being [i]The Final Reckoning[/i], released in 2025. The seventh, [i][[Mission: Impossible - Dead Reckoning Part One|Dead Reckoning Part One]][/i], also featured a promotional collaboration with [i][[Spy x Family]][/i] (Post #6482952, published on Twitter both by [i]Spy x Family[/i] and [i]Mission: Impossible[/i]'s official Japanese account), which included the [i]Spy x Family[/i] cast standing in for [i]Dead Reckoning Part One[/i] characters in the movie poster (for example, [[Twilight (Spy x Family)|Twilight]] as Ethan).

title: suppressor
body:
A firearm accessory designed to minimize audible report and [[muzzle flash]]. A suppressor basically consists of a tube that may screw or latch onto the end of a gun barrel and is filled with baffles that allow air otherwise pushed out the front of the gun to slow down and expand.

Suppressors are sometimes known as "silencers," but this is an exaggeration of the abilities of a suppressor to lessen sound. As long as bullet travels at supersonic speeds, it will still create the distinctive "boom." However, it is possible to make a very quiet weapon using subsonic ammunition, eliminating the sonic boom and thus the major source of loudness for a weapon.

body:

Also known as [b]fuwas[/b], or [b]fufu[/b] in Chinese, they have distinctive large heads with [[solid oval eyes|solid oval]] [[black eyes]], [[blush stickers]], and a D-shaped [[smile]] (though other expressions exist). They come in various sizes ranging from [[charm (object)|]]s to dolls large enough to wrap both arms around.

h4. Examples

* [[Fumo (doll)]], another distinctive line of dolls usually associated with the [[Touhou|Touhou Project]].

title: tohru_(maidragon)
body:
Tohru is a main character from [[Kobayashi-san chi no Maidragon]]. She is a [[dragon]] from a parallel world, who travels to modern-day Japan where she takes the form of a [[dragon girl]]. She lives with [[Kobayashi_(maidragon)|]] and [[Kanna Kamui]], while working as Kobayashi's [[maid]].

In her dragon girl form, she has [[long_hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] in [[twintails]] which [[gradient_hair|blends]] to [[orange_hair|orange]] towards the tips. She has [[orange eyes]] with [[slit pupils]]. Tohru always possess [[dragon horns]]. While at home she features a large green [[dragon tail]], but while out in society it is usually magically hidden. While in dragon girl form she very occasionally displays a pair of [[dragon wings]]. Tohru is most often depicted wearing a cosplay-style [[maid|maid uniform]] featuring a [[black dress|black]] [[pinafore dress]] over a [[white shirt]] with [[puffy short sleeves]], a red [[ascot]], [[white_gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves]] and a [[maid headdress]].

For her dragon form, see [[Tohru (Dragon) (maidragon)|]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #2551445

h4. See also

* [[Tohru (Dragon) (Maidragon)|]]

h4. External links

title: uninstallafell_(meme)
body:
A dancing [[Lalafell]] from [[Final Fantasy XIV]]. It has been mostly used to troll [[World of Warcraft]] players into becoming "WoWfugees" by uninstalling WoW and moving to Final Fantasy XIV among the exodus from the game in July 2021.

h4. Examples

* !asset #23379315

h4. External links

* "KnowYourMeme: Uninstallafell":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/uninstallafell

title: progress_pride_flag
body:
A variant of the [[LGBT pride|LGBT]] [[rainbow flag]], with an additional chevron consisting of a white, pink, blue, brown and black stripe on the left side, as to represent transgender people and racial minorities.

h4. Examples

* !asset #21993175

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Rainbow flag (LGBT)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rainbow_flag_(LGBT)#Variations]

title: ice_kirby
body:
A common [[copy ability]] throughout the [[Kirby (series)|]] series that lets [[Kirby]] breathe [[ice]].

In this form, Kirby wears a [[purple headwear|purple]] or [[gold headwear|gold]] [[crown]] of [[ice]] decorated with a [[star hat ornament|star]] in its center. In some games, it turns Kirby's skin [[blue skin|blue]].

h4. Icon

!asset #24553622

h4. See also

* [[Frosty Ice Kirby]]
* [[Blizzard Ice Kirby]]

title: bomb_kirby
body:
A common [[copy ability]] throughout the [[Kirby (series)|]] series that lets [[Kirby]] throw [[bomb]]s.

This form's appearance has varied over the years, but in its modern form, Kirby wears a [[blue headwear|blue]] [[cone hat]] with a [[fireworks print]], a [[blue gemstone]] in its center, and a [[red ribbon|red]] [[hat ribbon]] at its end. Its older form has Kirby wear a floppy [[blue headwear|blue]] [[hat]] with a [[pom pom (clothes)|pom pom]] at its tip.

h4. Icon

!asset #24553634

h4. See also

* [[Chain Bomb Kirby]]
* [[Homing Bomb Kirby]]

title: mecha_kirby
body:
A [[copy ability]] that appears in [[Kirby's Return to Dream Land Deluxe]] which turns [[Kirby]] into a [[mecha]].

When in this form, Kirby wears a [[blue headwear|blue]] [[helmet]] with a futuristic [[yellow-tinted eyewear|yellow]] [[visor]]. This helmet comes with a couple [[mechanical arms]] and [[cannon|cannons]] that can function as a [[jetpack]].

h4. Icon

!asset #24547302

title: wei_(weinnoiserie)
body:
[[Weinnoiserie]]'s [[original]] character. A self-insert into the world of [[Limbus Company]] that the author [[oc x canon|yume-ships]] with [[Ishmael (project moon)|]] from the same game.

She has [[orange eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[kishimen hair]], [[blonde hair|blonde]]-to-[[orange hair|orange]] in color, typically tied into a [[half updo]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #25041652

title: burning_kirby
body:
A [[copy ability]] used by [[Kirby]], letting him turn into a flaming ball. It is also referred to as Fireball, Burn, or Flame.

In some games, Burning Kirby has a crown with a flame insignia. In [[Kirby's Dream Buffet]], Burning Kirby resembles a red chili pepper.

Burning Kirby is replaced by [[Fire Kirby]] in most later games, with Burning's main attack part of Fire's moveset. Fire Kirby can be distinguished by [[breathing fire]], and the flaming tiara he wears in most appearances.

h4. Icon

!asset #24731361

title: daddycool's_tan'yao_(meme)
body:
A [[2channel]] meme, originally performed by [[ASCII Art]] character DaddyCool, who regularly makes errors in his [[mahjong]] [i]yaku[/i] score calculations. The joke is that the hand is not a tanyao worth only 1 han, but rather a [[suuankou]]-tanki yakuman hand worth 13 han. 

h4. Examples

* !asset #20195477 

h4.See also

* [[neta]]
* [[mahjong tile]]

h4.External links

* "DaddyCool":[http://riceballman.fc2web.com/AA-Illust/Data/DaddyCool.html]
* "Tan'yao/Tanyao":[http://riceballman.fc2web.com/AA-Illust/Data/Tanyao.html]
other_names: タンヤオ(アスキーアート)

title: place_lips_here_(meme)
body:
Artist [[meme]] template that originated from Twitter artist [[mitzubao|Mitzu]].

The template features a [[chibi]] character asking the viewer to "[[kissing_forehead|place lips]]" onto its [[forehead]], along with an aftermath of the character with a [[lipstick mark]] on their forehead after receiving a kiss.

h4. Examples

* !asset #18422615: Origin

h4. External links

* "Twitter: Origin":https://twitter.com/mitzubao/status/1738462443435880504

title: they_had_lots_of_sex_afterwards_(meme)
body:
この後滅茶苦茶セックスした ([i]Kono Ato Mechakucha Sex Shita[/i], "They[we] had lots of/wild sex afterwards")

A Twitter [[meme]] originally "offered":https://twitter.com/nyaromeron/statuses/358234816946241536 by [[Nyaromeron]] in July, 2013. "The square bubble was":http://twitpic.com/d3i6tz made by [[Tsukudani (coke-buta)]]. Started becoming popular at the end of the year.

It is also frequently used in mutations that reference the original such as "there was lots of crying afterwards" or "they had lots of lecturing afterwards".  

Salient traits are a plain box that has text that says "they had/there was lots of _____ afterwards."

The equivalent English phrase is "And then they fucked".

h4. Examples

* !asset #22979795

h4. External links

* "Ameblo.jp: Explanation by Hisame (exice)":[http://ameblo.jp/nao-ls2/entry-11742296564.html]
* "Nicopedia: このあと滅茶苦茶セックスした":[https://dic.nicovideo.jp/a/%E3%81%93%E3%81%AE%E3%81%82%E3%81%A8%E6%BB%85%E8%8C%B6%E8%8B%A6%E8%8C%B6%E3%82%BB%E3%83%83%E3%82%AF%E3%82%B9%E3%81%97%E3%81%9F]

title: all_the_statesmen!
body:
[b]All the Statesmen! Learning with Manga: The History of the American Frontier[/b]

[quote]
Emergency! Emergency! Crisis in Chaldea!
The Master, their Servants, and even the staff have been affected by a sudden onset of total worthlessness!
The Main Character must Rayshift to the singularity that is the source of this terrible plague: North America during the Western Expansion.
A fearsome threat looms over the continent, and the Main Character faces their toughest battle yet.
In their moment of need, aid comes in the most unlikely form, who turns out to be none other than...!?
[/quote]

A limited time event in [[Fate/Grand Order]] serving as a collaboration with [[Learning with Manga! FGO]], released on the Japanese server on August 2, 2017 and on the NA server on July 3, 2019. [[Paul Bunyan (fate)|]] is given as a reward to players for completing the event.

title: ipod_classic
body:
The original [[iPod]] as it was first introduced in 2001.

It has a large circular button interface which eventually developed into the Click Wheel which can be used for convenient scrolling. Although it boasts the largest storage for any [[digital media player]] (up to 160 GB), the eventual shortage of replacement parts and decreasing demand (no thanks to the easier usability of the touchscreen iPods: [[ipod Touch|Touch]] and [[ipod nano 6g|sixth]] and [[ipod nano 7g|seventh]] generation [[ipod nano|Nanos]]) led to its discontinuation.

There is much less visual difference between the generations, so most of the models are not tagged.

Unlike the other iterations, the Classic models only come in black and silver.

h4. Examples

* !asset #22596031: [[ipod classic 1g|1G]]/2G, [[ipod classic 3g|3G]], 4G, iPod Photo, 5G, 6G

title: spark_kirby
body:
A common [[copy ability]] throughout the [[Kirby (series)|]] series that lets [[Kirby]] [[electrocution|electrocute]] any enemy that approaches him.

In this form, Kirby wears a [[gold headwear|gold]] [[tiara]] with a [[blue gemstone]] in its center with several waves of blue [[electricity]] coming off of his head.

h4. Icon

!asset #24731338

title: tokusatsu
body:
Tokusatsu (lit. "special effects") is a genre of Japanese [[superhero costume|superhero]]/[[kaiju]] live action film or TV shows. It was made popular by series like [[Ultra Series|Ultraman]], [[Super Sentai]] and [[Kamen Rider]].

Often features full-body costumed actors, intense choreography, numerous action scenes, as well as considerable use of special effects. 

h4. Notable tokusatsu franchises

* [[Chouseishin Series]]
* [[Gamera (series)|]]
* [[Godzilla (series)|]]
* [[Kamen Rider]]
* [[Metal Hero]]
* [[Super Sentai]]
* [[Ultra Series]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Tokusatsu":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tokusatsu]

title: mei_hanxue_(younger)
body:
The head disciple of Kunlun Taxue Palace. He has a shared childhood with [[Xue Meng]], and as usually seen flirting with women.

[spoilers]He's the younger of two [[twins]], having a different "含"/hán character in his name than his [[mei_hanxue_(older)|older brother]]. In comparison, he's much friendlier and often shirks his duties.[/spoilers]

title: spear_kirby
body:
A [[copy ability]] that appears in [[Kirby's Return to Dream Land]], [[Kirby's Return to Dream Land Deluxe]], [[Kirby: Triple Deluxe]], and [[Kirby Battle Royale]] which lets [[Kirby]] wield a [[spear]].

In this form, Kirby wears a [[red headband]] with a notable yellow [[forehead protector]] in its center.

h4. Icon

!asset #24731394

title: launching
body: When a flying character or vehicle is preparing for takeoff into the air. The opposite of this is [[landing]].

title: whip_kirby
body:
A common [[copy ability]] throughout the newer entries in the [[Kirby (series)|]] series that lets [[Kirby]] wield a [[whip]].

In this form, Kirby wears a [[red headwear|red]] [[cowboy hat]] with several [[star hat ornament|stars]] around its brim.

h4. Icon

!asset #24958430

title: archer_kirby
body:
A [[copy ability]] that appears in [[Kirby: Triple Deluxe]], [[Kirby: Planet Robobot]], and the [[Kirby Fighters 2|Kirby Fighters series]] which lets [[Kirby]] fire off several [[arrow (projectile)|]]s at once.

When in this form, Kirby wears a [[purple headwear|purple]] [[hat]] with a [[hat feather|feather]] inside it, and he holds a [[bow (weapon)|]] and often an [[arrow (projectile)|]].

h4. Icon

!asset #24731395

title: hammer_kirby
body:
A common [[copy ability]] throughout the [[Kirby (series)|]] series that lets [[Kirby]] wield an insanely powerful [[mallet]].

In this form, Kirby wears a [[two-tone headband|two-tone]] [[hachimaki]] in [[white headband|white]] and [[blue headband|blue]] (though in some games it is pure [[white headband|white]]). He also wields an [[huge weapon|oversized]] mallet that resembles [[King Dedede]]'s own mallet.

h4. Icon

!asset #24731384

h4. See also

* [[Grand Hammer Kirby]]
* [[Toy Hammer Kirby]]
* [[Wild Hammer Kirby]]
* [[Masked Hammer Kirby]]

title: mei_hanxue_(older)
body: [spoilers]The older of the [[twins]]. His name is spelled differently, with a "寒" for the hán character in his name. Compared to his [[mei_hanxue_(younger)|younger brother]], he is much more stoic and serious, and has a dual fire/water core.[/spoilers]

title: shi_mei
body:
One of [[Chu Wanning]]'s disciples. As [[Mo Ran]]'s original crush, his death in the original timeline serves as his main motivator in his reborn life.

[spoilers]He merely faked his death in the original timeline-- this version of him is actually [[Hua Binan]].[/spoilers]

title: xue_meng
body:
One of [[Chu Wanning]]'s disciples, and [[Mo Ran]]'s cousin. His parents are [[Xue Zhengyong]] and [[Wang Chuqing]].

[spoilers]Though [[Wang Chuqing]] is his mother, his real father is revealed to be [[Jiang Xi]].[/spoilers]

title: mayqueen_maid_uniform
body:
A particular type of [[maid|maid uniform]] used by [[Akiha Rumiho]] and others working at the [[MayQueen_nyan_nyan|MayQueen+Nyan²]] maid cafe in [[Steins;Gate]].

The maid uniform consists of a [[black hairband]] with a [[maid headdress]], [[red ribbon]]s and two long [[cat ears]] attached to it, a [[white shirt]] and [[black skirt]] with a [[maid apron|maid]] [[waist apron]]. The uniform also includes a [[black vest]] with [[underbust]] [[grey belt]] around it.

title: strainer
body:
An object that is either perforated or made out of mesh, allowing liquids to train from it's contents while retaining solids. Commonly [[bowl]]-shaped, but can have other shapes.

h4. Examples
* !asset #20077017: simple strainer

title: tea_strainer
body:
A type of strainer that is placed over or in a teacup to catch loose tea leaves.

When tea is brewed in the traditional manner in a teapot, the tea leaves are not contained in teabags; rather, they are freely suspended in the water. As the leaves themselves are not consumed with the tea, it is usual to filter them out with a tea strainer. Strainers usually fit into the top of the cup to catch the leaves as the tea is poured. 

h4.See also

* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: bamboo_steamer
body:
A round or oval cookware made from [[bamboo]] with a lattice bottom and a cover. They are often stacked on top of each other so that the steam can cook many different servings simultaneously.

Often used to make [[dim sum]].

Called [i]mushiki[/i] (蒸し器) in Japanese.

h4. Examples

* !post #7933766
* !post #8230144

title: helltaker
body:
A short indie puzzle/romance/[spoiler]bullet hell rhythm[/spoiler] game created by Polish developer [[vanripper]]. The full game is available for free on Steam, and can be comfortably beaten in about two hours.

It is about a man who wakes up from a dream of having a [[harem]] of [[demon girl]]s and decides that he will descend into hell to make said dream come true, which earns him the nickname [[Helltaker (character)|]].

Overall it's about a search for love, kicking skeletons around, trying not to get murdered by sharply dressed demon girls, getting murdered anyway, and [[chocolate]] [[pancake]]s.

There is also an artbook that fleshes out the characters a bit more. It can be unlocked through the secret ending, or purchased as DLC.

h4. Characters

* Protagonist [[Helltaker_(character)|]] 
* Narrator [[Beelzebub_(helltaker)|]]
* [[Pandemonica_(helltaker)|]] 
* [[Modeus_(helltaker)|]] 
* [[Cerberus_(helltaker)|]] 
* [[Malina_(helltaker)|]] 
* [[Zdrada_(helltaker)|]] 
* [[Azazel_(helltaker)|]] 
* [[Justice_(helltaker)|]] 
* [[Lucifer_(helltaker)|]] 
* [[Judgement_(helltaker)|]] 
* [[Skeleton_(helltaker)|]] (often used with [[glorious success]])
* [[Archangel_(helltaker)|]] (unofficial name)
* [[Police_(helltaker)|]] (unofficial name)
* [[Police_swat_(helltaker)|]] (unofficial name)
* [[Subject_67_(helltaker)|]] (added in anniversary update) 
* [[Loremaster_(helltaker)|]] (added in anniversary update) 

h4. External links

title: baoh
body:
Ikuro Hashizawa also known as Baoh is the protagonist of [[Baoh Raihousha]].

Baoh, the bio-weapon, Ikuro's body undergoes a transformation. The region surrounding his eyes is cracked like a shell, revealing a dark or shadowy interior, and his eyes emit a constant glow. His hair gives way to a flowing mass of long strands of what appears to be flesh. Within his forehead is embedded a unique sensory organ called a "tactile sensor," which appears as a vertical oval emanating light surrounded by darkness.

title: leaf_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Leaf[/b] is the female player character in [i][[pokemon frlg|Pokémon FireRed and LeafGreen]][/i].

This cheerful and friendly Trainer has an insatiable sense of adventure and absolute confidence in her battling skills.

She has [[brown eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] including [[hair flaps]]. She wears a [[white headwear|white]] [[bucket hat|hat]], a [[blue shirt|blue]] [[sleeveless shirt|shirt]], [[black wristband|black]] [[wristband|wristbands]], a [[red skirt|red]] [[pleated skirt|skirt]], [[blue socks|blue]] [[loose socks|socks]], [[white shoes]], and carries a [[yellow bag|yellow]] [[messenger bag]] with a [[vs seeker]] on the strap.

h4. Official Art
* !post #4559773: Default

h4. See also
* Male counterpart: [[Red (pokemon)|]]
* [[Pokemon LGPE|LGPE]] and [[Pokemon Adventures]] counterpart: [[Green (pokemon)|]]
* [[Kanto Mother (rgby/frlg)|]]

title: drop_trap
body:
A type of trap commonly used on hard to capture feral cats. It is a container, typically netting over a light frame, that is propped up on one side by a stick. A string is fastened to the stick, so it can be pulled by the trapper to cause the container to completely enclose the prey.

h4. See also

* [[pitfall]]
* [[bear trap]]

title: love_live!_nijigasaki_high_school_idol_club
body:
The third entry in the [[Love Live!]] franchise. Originally announced as a spinoff of the [[Love Live! School Idol Festival]] mobile game under the working title [i]PERFECT Dream Project[/i], it was later revealed at Tokyo Game Show 2017 to be a brand new idol group who would be the main story focus of the upcoming [[Love Live! School Idol Festival All Stars]]. It follows the members of the Nijigasaki High School Idol Club, comprised of the three most popular N (Normal)-Rarity idols voted in from [i]School Idol Festival[/i], plus new characters introduced in [i]All Stars[/i]. 

Unlike the other Love Live! titles before it, this entry follows solo school idols, each performing with their own styles and preferences.

An anime adaptation was announced in December 2019 and aired from October to December 2020. Its second season was announced in May 2021 and aired from April to June 2022. 

h4. Characters

title: atole_(lilatole)
body:
[[Original]] character created my artist [[lilatole]].

According to "this tweet":[https://x.com/LilAtole/status/1915911254725587120] by the artist, rather than an a character she is a [[artist self-insert|self-insert]]. She is a [[dark-skinned female|dark-skinned girl]] with [[black hair|black]] [[long hair]] (Usually loose, alternatively tied into a [[ponytail]]) with [[blunt bangs]], [[small breasts]], and she usually wears a pair of [[round eyewear|round glasses]].

title: love_live!
body:
A Japanese multimedia franchise by [[Bushiroad]] in collaboration with [[Sunrise (company)|]], revolving around groups of fictional high school girls who become idols to compete in the titular national school idol tournament.

It is notable for being one of the first to link the fictional idol character with the [[real life]] semi-idol group consisting of a newly recruited [[voice actor|voice actress]] specifically for the character (with the exception of some members of the first installment who already had an existing voice acting and music career). This format would later be replicated by its sister franchise [[BanG Dream!]], which is fully managed by Bushiroad themselves.

h4. Series

* [[Love Live! School Idol Project]]
* [[Love Live! Sunshine!!]]
* [[Love Live! Nijigasaki High School Idol Club]]
* [[Love Live! Superstar!!]]
* [[Link! Like! Love Live!]]
* [[Ikizulive! Love Live! Bluebird]]

h4. Games

* [[Love Live! School Idol Festival]] 
* [[Love Live! School Idol Festival ~After School ACTIVITY~]]
* [[Love Live! School Idol Festival All Stars]]
* [[Love Live! School Idol Festival 2]]
* [[Love Live! Series Official Card Game]]

h4. See also

* [[Genjitsu no Yohane]]
* [[Love Live! School Idol Musical]]
* [[List of Love Live! characters]]

title: multicolored_skin
body:
When a character has two or more distinct colors making up their layer of skin. All skin colors present should be tagged, if possible.

This doesn't include naturally occurring differences in colors such as [[areolae]], [[nipples]], [[bruise]]s, [[tan]] and [[blush|blushing]] to name a few. At least one of the skin colors has to be [[colored skin|unnatural]] and the colors have to be visually distinct from each other. 

For instance, post #4438684 has [[blue skin]] and [[yellow skin]] divided evenly on her flesh.

h4. See also
* [[two-tone skin]]
* [[Vitiligo]]

This is a list of the disambiguation wiki pages for terms that refer to multiple tags. One use of this list is for finding and retagging posts that use such tags. Another is to prepare in case we eventually decide to implement an ambiguous tag color code.

h4. Tags in Current Use

These tags are potentially ambiguous, but are in widespread use to identify an object, term or character. They also double as disambiguation pages to guide to similarly named tags. Further discussion is needed to determine if qualifiers would be needed, as not every tag listed necessarily needs a qualifier. Their current use is denoted in brackets. If the tag gets changed, please remove it from this portion of the page and move it appropriately.

* [[2channel]] (Japanese textboard site) vs. [[2ch.ru]] (former Russian imageboard site) 
* [[Airship]] (a ship-looking vehicle flying in the air), vs. [[dirigible]] (blimps, zeppelins, etc.)

title: akizuki_ryo
body:
One of the main characters of the [[Idolmaster]] series, introduced in the DS game [[Idolmaster Dearly Stars]].

Soft-spoken 15-year-old Ryou is an idol from 876 Productions and cousin of 765 Production's intern-turned-idol, [[Akizuki Ritsuko]]. Ryou is actually a [[trap|boy]]; who, fed up with his lack of a love life and unwanted attention from boys, asked Ritsuko to help turn him into a cool male idol. She then introduced him to [i]876[/i], only to be dressed up as a girl in a desperate attempt to save a show whose actual performer never showed up in time. He becomes part of the unit [[Dearly Stars (idolmaster)|]] for a time.

He appears in [[Idolmaster Side-M]], where he has changed representation from 876 to 315 Productions and now works openly as a male idol, joining the unit [[F-LAGS_(idolmaster)|]]. He is also the only [i]boy[/i], let alone a [[crossdressing]] one, to make appearances in [[Idolmaster Cinderella Girls]].

Ryou's theme color is mint green, and he is voiced by [[Sanpei Yuuko]]. 

h4. External links

* "Project iM@S Wiki: Ryo Akizuki":http://www.project-imas.wiki/Ryo_Akizuki

title: mizuki_(arknights)
body:
[i]Landship observation target Mizuki, latent threat principally confirmed low at the present stage.[/i]

A playable Specialist Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile

A somewhat mysterious boy who came to Rhodes Island after the events of Dossoles Holiday. While cute and honest, his jumbled past and unusual Arts mean there may be more to him than meets the eye.

Mizuki is a side character in [i]Dossoles Holiday[/i] and is the protagonist of the third season of Integrated Strategies, [i]Mizuki and Caerula Arbor[/i].

Subject to similar [[trap]] depictions as [[Ansel (arknights)|]].

His motif is based on Moon Jellyfish.

His [[voice actor]] is [[Murase Ayumu]].

title: dark_sun_gwyndolin
body:
The second son of Lord Gwyn in the game [[Dark Souls I]]. His affinity with the [[moon]], a traditionally female trait, caused him to be raised [[trap|as a girl]].

Wears a spiked, [[sun symbol|sun]]-shaped [[mask]] with a [[veil]], a long [[white robe]], and has a lower body composed entirely of numerous [[tentacles|tentacular]] [[snake|snakes]]. Skilled in [[magic|sorcery]], [[illusion]]s, and [[bow (weapon)|archery]].

[spoiler]By the time of [[Dark Souls III]], Gwyndolin has been consumed by [[aldrich devourer of gods|Aldrich]].[/spoiler]

title: shimakaze-kun
body:
An unofficial male version of [[Shimakaze (kancolle)|]] of [[Kantai Collection]].

Due to the revealing nature of the original's clothes, Shimakaze-kun will often be an identical-looking [[trap]].

Depending on context, Shimakaze-kun can be tagged two different ways:
* Usually, Shimakaze-kun is a male [[cosplay|cosplaying]] as Shimakaze. The context is the "real world", where Shimakaze is a memetic character from an online game and media franchise.  This should be tagged [[shimakaze (kancolle) (cosplay)]].
* Less commonly, he may be the actual Shimakaze but male. It may be an alternate reality where Shimakaze was always male, or Shimakaze may have been transformed into a male by some event. The context is the world of Kantai Collection, where Shimakaze is a real person. This should be tagged [[genderswap (ftm)]].

Where insufficient context exists, tagging is up to user discretion, but be consistent. In particular, the first case implies the character is "not really" Shimakaze, while the second implies the character "really" is. Thus they are generally mutually exclusive.

body:

Started streaming in December 2022, though his current outfit debuted on January 2025.

A perpetually [[bags under eyes|tired]] and overworked [[demon]] with a [[trap|feminine appearance]]. Has [[demon horns|horns]] and a [[demon tail|tail]], as well as [[very long hair|long]] [[messy hair|messy]] [[pink hair|pink]] [[two-tone hair|and]] [[black hair]] with [[thick eyebrows]] and [[sharp teeth]]. Works as an intern for a questionable company at very late hours.

Wears an [[off shoulder]] [[oversized clothes|oversized]] [[lab coat]] that [[sleeves past fingers|goes past his hands]], along with a [[turtleneck sweater]] and [[bike shorts|spats]]. Also sports [[asymmetrical legwear|mismatched legwear]], and an [[ID card]] on his chest. Sometimes drinks from a small [[juice box|carton]].

title: z1_leberecht_maass_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the German destroyer Z1 [i]Leberecht Maass[/i]. Character design by [[Shimada Fumikane]], voiced by [[Endou Aya]].

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[grey hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. Her default outfit, shared with her sister Z3, consists of a dark [[blue hat|blue]] [[sailor hat]] with her name on it, a [[blue dress|blue]] [[sailor dress]] and [[blue sailor collar|sailor collar]], [[black neckerchief]], dark [[blue socks]], and [[ankle boots]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her funnel and foremast to her back, connecting two hull pieces that have her 12.8 cm single gun mounts and 533 mm triple [[torpedo tubes]], as well as a third 12.8 cm twin [[handgun]] mount.

She is often depicted as a [[trap]] in fanart due to her somewhat masculine voice and mannerisms along with her [[androgynous]] looks.

title: maria_holic
body:
A 2006 comedy manga by [[Endou Minari]] and adapted by [[SHAFT (company)|]] into two anime series in 2009 and 2011.

Androphobic lesbian [[Miyamae Kanako]] comes to the Catholic, all-female Ame No Kisaki high school (as a second-year transferee) to find her "true love", which she found in the form of incoming freshman [[Shidou Mariya]], only to discover - much to her horror - that Mariya turns out to be a [[trap|sadistic crossdresser]], who then proceeds to blackmail her into keeping his gender a secret.

title: bridget_(guilty_gear)
body:
A character from the [[Guilty Gear]] fighting game series. First appearing in [[Guilty Gear XX]], born as one of two male twins in an [[united kingdom|English]] village where the birth of same-sex twins was considered bad luck, they were raised as a girl, prompting their [[trap]] appearance. 

Throughout [i]Guilty Gear XX[/i], they would reject the stigma of their upbringing and work towards proving their masculinity as a bounty hunter. Years later, as of [i][[Guilty Gear Strive]][/i], Bridget had since succeeded, dispelling the superstition of their village. In absence of that purpose, they experience unresolved doubts, ultimately determining to be true to herself, embracing her identity as a girl across the conclusions of her story.

Debuted in [i]XX[/i] with a sleeveless and shortened [[nun]] habit (for ease of movement, not because they are a nun), a giant handcuff as an accessory, and [[bike shorts]]. In [i]Strive[/i], the nun habit is replaced with a similar [[hooded jacket]], with the habit's [[mars symbol]], pointed to the upper-right, changed to an [[androgyne symbol]], pointed to the upper-left, matching the orientations of these elements as in the [[transgender symbol|⚧ symbol]]. In either case, they wield a [[yo-yo]] and their pet [[teddy bear]] [[Roger (Guilty Gear)|]] in battle.

[i]Current policy is to tag Bridget as male unless physical evidence in the image proves otherwise, including the presence of the [[transgender flag]]. Non-bodily evidence (e.g. [[transgender flag]]) is only relevant to {{Rating:General}} posts.[/i]

title: kuja
body:
The main villain of [[Final Fantasy IX]], Kuja is an [[androgynous]]/[[trap]] sorcerer who reveals himself to be a cruel manipulator and an more extreme narcissist, and he is responsible for the majority of the game's events.

[b][i]Major spoilers[/i][/b]
[spoiler]He is responsible for manipulating [[Brahne Raza Alexandros XVI]] to go to war; extracting [[Garnet til Alexandros XVII]]'s eidolons and attempting to extract [[Eiko Carol]]'s eidolons; creating the Black Mages to use as killer soldiers, and verbally tortures [[Vivi Ornitier]] about it; causing the events that led to Alexandria's destruction (and inadvertently making Garnet lose her voice); betraying [[Garland (FF9)|]]; destroying the planet Terra; and then threatening to destroy Gaia when he discovers he doesn't have long to live. As a Genome given a soul by Garland, Kuja can be considered the older brother of [[Zidane Tribal]] and [[Mikoto (FF9)|]].[/spoiler]

title: reverse_trap
body:
Per [[trap|trap]], a female character who looks and may or may not act masculine. Most likely also dresses like a male, although unlike mere [[crossdressing]] the character is assumed by others to be male until demonstrated otherwise.

As a rule of thumb, if you can correctly tell the gender with complete certainty from the thumbnail alone, it's not a reverse trap.

Often indicated on Pixiv by the [b]男装[/b] ([i]Dansou[/i] lit. "masculine clothes/disguising oneself as a man") and [b]男装の麗人[/b] ([i]Dansou no Reijin[/i] lit. "A beautiful woman disguised as a man") tags. See also [[tomboy]], which may overlap. pool #6118 may also overlap in some places, but is not necessarily the standard.

title: usura
body:
Artist specializing mostly in [[trap|otoko no ko]] wearing [[highleg]] outfits and general [[BDSM]]. His/her art style is mostly represented with the use of very feminine-looking boys [[crossdressing]] in girl's clothing.  Often times, the use of a female body and head is used in his/her artstyle, but with the addition of a male chest and a [[penis]] with balls.  Posts works in a site called Seraphita.

2/1/2010:
Usura's last post on Seraphita was around 5/22/2009.  No new pictures have been presented on that forum since then, leading to the conclusion that either Usura has put away his art supplies, is on a very long hiatus, is working on a very large-scaled project (such as a doujinshi), or has moved to a different site to present works (although no new pictures of Usura's has surfaced at ALL since the previously mentioned date).  Since no further information about his/her status has come forth, as well as alternate websites where he/she is officially posting, it is mostly assumed that Usura has simply quit.
I am changing this artist's status to "inactive" because of this assumption.  (If anyone feels that I am doing this in error, please correct me and post further details as to where the artist has moved to, or his/her current status.)
-NT110

Artist name: うすらとんかち (Usura Tonkachi) or USURA
Name of the Imageboard that the artist was active in: 女装少年板

body:

body:

Use [[futanari]] (or [[full-package futanari]] or [[futa without pussy]]) when a character is a girl with a dick. Use [[male futanari]] (or [[cuntboy]]) when a character is a male with a [[pussy]].

Use [[crossdressing]] when a character is wearing clothing that is traditionally associated with the opposite gender.

Use [[androgynous]] when a character has both masculine and feminine traits which makes their gender hard to tell. 
* If the character's gender hasn't been officially announced, use [[1other]]
* If the character is known male but has noticeable feminine traits that can mistaken him for a girl, use [[trap]]
* If the character is known female but has noticeable masculine traits that can mistaken her for a boy, use [[reverse trap]]

title: ezra_theodore
body:
[b]Ezra Theodore[/b] is a playable character from [[Reverse:1999]]. A young child doctor from [[Australia]], due to his [[trap|feminine looks]], he was at first mistaken as a girl by [[Spathodea_(Reverse:1999)|Spathodea]]. Despite being human, Ezra is skilled in using magical mushrooms to help his allies. He is the main male protagonist of the "Revival! The Uluru Games" side story.

Ezra is voiced by Lindsay Rolland-Mills in English and [[Katou Emiri]] in Japanese.

h4. Appearance

title: hoshikawa_lily
body:
[[Zombie Land Saga]] character.

The youngest member of the [[idol]] group Franchouchou. She was reanimated 7 years later in order to join the [[Zombie Land Saga]] Project. 

When in zombie form, her [[heart out of chest|heart often sits outside her chest]]. It's able to be concealed for public appearances, but will come out if she is shocked.

She was born in [[Saga Prefecture]], and spoke in Saga dialect before becoming a TV star.

[spoiler]Her birth name is Go Masao, and she was born male. Her cause of death was a heart attack resulting from a combination of being overworked and [[gender dysphoria]]: the sudden shock upon discovering she'd grown facial hair after hitting puberty.

When tagging use [[1girl]] for normal appearances and [[1boy]] and [[trap]] when her body or former identity is directly referenced.
[/spoiler]

Voiced by [[Tanaka Minami (voice actor)|]].

h4. External Links

* Pixiv Encyclopedia: "Hoshikawa Lily":[https://dic.pixiv.net/a/星川リリィ]

title: futa_without_pussy
body:
Visually similar to [[futanari]] with [[penis]] and [[testicles]] but no [[pussy|vagina]]. That is to say, the character has a female body but male sex organs.

This tag should be used if you can either visually confirm the character has no vagina or there is information that clearly supports that the character doesn't have one, such as the tags used in the source, the artist's [[commentary]] or indicators in the art itself that confirms the character is a newhalf. When in doubt use the [[futanari]] tag instead.

On Danbooru, futa without pussy was previously referred to with the word "newhalf". Newhalf is a Japanese slang word for a pre-op or non-op male-to-female trans person, also referred to as "shemale" (シーメール). The word "newhalf" was originally used for referring a male who had begun to transition to female but kept her lower body the same; literally a "new half". Due to Danbooru's usage of the word not reflecting its real world usage, functionally using it more as a synonym for "futa without pussy", the tag was renamed to use that instead. The fates of the related tags below that still use the "newhalf" name have yet to be decided.

h4. Related tags

* [[newhalf with male]]
* [[newhalf with female]]
* [[newhalf with newhalf]]
* [[futa with newhalf]]

h4. See also

* [[Trap]] - boys that look very feminine in appearance
* [[Male with breasts]] - boys that have female breasts
* [[Cuntboy]] - boys with female genitalia only
* [[Poison (Final Fight)]] - a popular [[Capcom]] character that became infamously known for her potential status as a transsexual woman, which was left ambiguous by the developers and has remained a topic of frequent debate by fans and media alike
* [[Gender transitioning]] - characters who transition away from the sex they were assigned at birth

h4. External links

* "Wiktionary: newhalf":https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/newhalf

title: tsukishita_kaoru
body:
Former [[Virtual YouTuber]] and member of [[Holostars]] from the third batch, [[TriNero]]. A fledgling makeup artist with a deep voice contrasting his feminine appearance. As he loves cosmetics and cute things, he's trying to keep himself beautiful as well. Kaoru presented himself in a cute and bubbly manner, however, he would be perverted and also made dirty jokes sometimes. He is a huge fan of [[Beyblade]] and was adamant about adding that into his 'interests' section, or else "it's the same as leaving his soul behind".

His [[Beyblade]] ASMR stream was trending 1st place on Twitter in Japan after the stream was "noticed by Beyblade creator Takara Tomy":[https://twitter.com/takaratomytoys/status/1263679986554138624].

After three months of activities, he graduated on July 28, 2020 due to undisclosed personal circumstances.

He takes a distinctly [[trap|feminine-looking appearance]] with his [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]], though it is actually a [[wig]] - his true hair is much [[short hair|shorter]]. He has [[swept bangs]] and [[purple eyes]]. His outfit includes a [[white sweater|white]] [[turtleneck sweater]], [[black jacket]], [[brown shorts]], [[thighhighs]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heel boots]]. He also wears a [[black hairband]] with a [[black bow]] and yellow [[x hair ornament]] attached to it.

title: midare_toushirou
body:
A [[Touken Ranbu]] character.

A [[tantou]], and one of the many "Toushirou" brothers. Unlike most of the characters in the game, he looks extremely feminine to the point that he is a full-on [[trap]]. This is actually a reference to his namesake's hamon, which, unlike his brothers, is wavy instead of being straight, which is reflected through how he wears a frilly [[dress]] instead of a [[military uniform]] like his brothers. Personality-wise, he's very cheerful and friendly, but he'll occasionally make some suggestive comments.

His usual outfit consists of a dress with a [[necktie]], a [[hat]], [[Japanese armor]] (consisting of [[sode]] and [[kote]] on one side) and [[black thighhighs]]. He wears black [[shorts]] in his casual wear. His [[Midare Toushirou (Kiwame)|Kiwame]] form emphasizes his "girlyness" by giving him an even frillier dress, pink lamellar armor and [[high heels]] amongst other things.

He has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. He wears his hair in a [[ponytail]] when in his casual outfit. His Kiwame form turns two strands into [[twin braids|braids]], decorated with pink [[hair bow|bows]].

title: ash_(dross)
body:
An [[original|original character]] by [[Dross]].

[b]Ash[/b] is a [[trap|crossdresser]] with [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair|brown]] and [[pink hair|pink]] [[gradient hair]], and [[blue eyes]]. They wear a [[grey shirt]], [[wristband]]s (one checkered black & white, the other black & white stripes), red [[pants]], and [[green socks]]. They also have [[ear piercing]]s on both ears.

title: kai_(akuaya)
body:
The Emissary of Misery of [[Akuma Ouji to Ayatsuri Ningyou]].

Born from [[Mere (akuaya)|Mere's]] feelings of sorrow. He is quiet, but if his anger is unleashed he has difficulty reigning it in.

He is an [[angel]] [[trap]] with [[blue hair]] and [[purple eyes]]. Like his creator, he has a [[halo]]. There is a [[butterfly]] [[markings|marking]] on his [[marking on cheek|cheek]].

title: bishounen
body:
A Japanese term literally meaning [b]beautiful teenage boy[/b]. The equivalent English concept is [b]pretty boy[/b]. The term describes an aesthetic that can be found in disparate areas in Asia: a teenage boy, around 13 to 18 years old, whose beauty (and sexual appeal) transcends the boundary of gender or sexual orientation. Bishounen characters are fairly common in manga and anime; a heavy number of male characters show subtle signs of the bishounen style, such as slender eyes or a feminine face. 

Bishounen are usually drawn delicately, with long limbs, silky or flowing hair, and slender eyes with long eyelashes that can sometimes extend beyond the face. It's best to tag images that focus on the character's beauty, so there tends to be a heavier emphasis on solo or duo images here. Group images are fine, so long as the majority of the males exemplify this trait.

As the name suggests, the term is best used when you can still tell that the character is a male. If there are remarkable feminine traits, consider adding [[androgynous]]. For characters where their feminine traits are at the point of making you believe that they're a female, use [[trap]] instead.

Note that with [[genderswap (ftm)|female-to-male genderswaps]], this tag can apply if they possess the above-mentioned traits.

In English-speaking circles, bishounen is used somewhat more loosely than it is in Japan, effectively used for any male character with pseudo androgynous beauty, regardless of whether they are "shounen" or not (so variants covering those older than 18, ala biseinen, bichuunen, and bidanshi, find themselves incorporated, as well as those younger than 13).

h4. Examples

* !post #3331027
* !post #4151953
* !post #5566960
* !post #5965649
other_names: なにこれ男の子かわいい

title: tank_top
body:
A sleeveless top with wide straps, worn by both genders.

A top for women with thin [[spaghetti strap|spaghetti straps]] is called a [[camisole]], while a camisole that goes past the hips might be either a [[chemise]] or a [[babydoll]].

A cut-off tank top to expose the [[midriff]] is either a [[crop top]] or a [[sports bra]] depending on the context.

A tank top like swimsuit is a [[tankini]].

h4. See also

* [[camisole]]
* [[crop top]]
* [[sports bra]]
* [[sundress]]
* [[tankini]]
* [[undershirt]]
* [[Tag Group:Attire]]

title: hypnotizing_viewer
body: When a character is using hypnosis on the pov of an image. Such posts should [b]not[/b] be tagged [[mind control]] if they don't depict a mind being controlled (for example, by showing the result of the hypnosis).

title: self_hypnosis
body: When someone performs a [[hypnosis]] on themselves, intentionally or not.

title: shellos
body:
[[pokemon (creature)|Pokémon]] #0422 in the National Pokédex, a Water-type.

Resembles a [[sea slug]] with [[yellow eyes]], [[yellow lips]], and a [[dot nose]]. Has two different forms: the pink and white [[shellos (west)|West Sea]] form and the blue and green [[shellos (east)|East Sea]] form.

Evolves into [[Gastrodon]].

Japanese name: [b]Karakanushi[/b]

title: konan_mia
body:
A [[virtual YouTuber]] and member of [[Nanashi Inc.]], merged from the [[Animare]] sub-group on March 21st 2023. She is somewhat well-known for constantly hunting for a husband. Planned to graduate on August 31st 2024 but canceled because she has too much debt she needs to pay off.

She is a [[meerkat girl|meerkat]] [[meerkat ears|girl]] with [[short hair|short]] [[light brown hair]] and [[medium bangs|medium-length]] [[swept bangs]] with [[too many hair ornaments]].

title: jersey_maid
body:
An unconventional [[maid]] costume that utilizes a [[track suit]] or a [[track jacket]] as the base.

May be simply a longer jacket worn like a dress, a skirt and jacket combo, or a track pants + jacket set, but the costume needs some maid-like elements, like a [[maid apron]] or a [[maid headdress]].

title: fire_emblem_awakening
body:
[b]Fire Emblem: Kakusei[/b] (ファイアーエムブレム覚醒, Fire Emblem: Awakening) is a Japanese tactical role-playing game for the [[Nintendo 3DS]], developed by Intelligent Systems and published by Nintendo. 
The game was released on April 19, 2012, in Japan, February 4, 2013, in North America and April 19, 2013, in Europe. 

The story focuses on prince Chrom of the Halidom of Ylisse and his companions as they struggle during a turbulent era.

title: luna_(kyokugen_dasshutsu)
body:
A character introduced in [[Kyokugen Dasshutsu ADV: Zennin Shibou Desu]]. [spoiler]She is an [[android]], specifically a [[GAULEM (kyokugen dasshutsu)|]], modeled after [[Diana (kyokugen dasshutsu)|]].[/spoiler]

Has [[blue eyes]] and [[orange hair]] with [[sidelocks]] and a [[braided bun]]. Wears a light [[purple shirt|purple]], [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[blouse]] under a [[white vest]], a [[long skirt|long]], dark [[purple skirt]], [[purple thighhighs]], and [[white slippers]]. She has a [[necklace]] with an ornament of a [[birdcage|caged]] [[bluebird]] attached to it.

body:
[[Cu Chulainn Alter (fate)|]] in his Third Ascension outfit from [[Fate/Grand Order]]. While his Second Ascension adds red fur trim around his shoulders, wrists and ankles, this Ascension includes a tattered black cape and additional spikes on his body. [[Gae Bolg (fate)|]] also becomes noticeably spikier along the pole and near the blade.

Due to the similarities between this and his Second Ascension, it may be difficult at times to tell which one he is in. If that happens, do not use this tag.

title: super_smash_bros.
body:
A popular [[crossover]] fighting game series published by [[Nintendo]].

The Japanese title of the franchise is 大乱闘スマッシュブラザーズ ([i]Dai-Rantou Smash Brothers[/i], lit. Great Fray Smash Brothers), often shortened to スマブラ ([i]Sumabura[/i]).

title: savior_(eversoul)
body:
The player character and protagonist of [[Eversoul]].

He was once just a normal human from 21st century Earth, until one day, he was suddenly summoned to Eden (an alternate Earth set in the distant future) by the summoning ritual of the Souls [[Mephistopheles (Eversoul)|]] and Queen [[Yuria (Eversoul)|]] to be chosen as the Savior of Souls and the new administrator of the first Ark "Metatron". He holds Dominion over Soul Mastery, allowing him to create mutual contracts with Souls wherein they gain greater power than before in exchange for them assisting him in battles when needed, though his physiological disadvantages as a normal human and his general lack of experience prevents him from fully utilizing his power.

He's currently the only human on the Souls' side of the war against the Gates and also the only "old" human (Homo sapiens) within the setting. [spoilers]He would later become one of two humans aided by Souls in fighting against the predestined apocalypse alongside former enemy and fellow Soul Master Kayrin Faust.[/spoilers]

[spoiler]His true role is later revealed to be the Singularity, a special being chosen by the universe to hold the innate ability to defy conventional space-time laws and create branches in time with each choice they confront while also being the telltale sign of their world's imminent apocalypse once certain conditions are met.[/spoiler]

h4. Appearance
* !post #5875427: Key visual
* !post #5860306: Key visual
He is a young human man, presumably in between his late teens to early adulthood, with [[brown hair]] and [[grey eyes]]. His usual attire mostly follows the same color scheme as Mephi and Yuria, consisting of him wearing a [[black shirt|black]] [[turtleneck]] shirt under a [[white coat]] with various [[gold|golden]] [[jewelry]] and a [[single pauldron|single]] golden [[pauldron]] on his left shoulder, followed by [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[elbow gloves]], [[white pants]] and [[white boots]]. He's usually seen with a small [[cane]] either held by his left hand or strapped to his waist, which he uses both as a blunt weapon and a magic tool for his Soul Master abilities.

His face has only been shown in his in-game portrait, promotional art, and 3D in-game cutscenes. Most CGs that show him usually keep his [[head out of frame]] as per his role as a self-insert character.

title: hecate_(arena_breakout)
body:
[b]Hecate[/b] is a recurring boss in [[Arena Breakout]]. A mercenary and expert Mountain climber whose real name is unknown, she is the leader of Abyss Squad, an elite unit in the PMC Black Gold International. In the game, the player fights her and Abyss Squad when battling Black Gold International.

In the [[Girls' Frontline]] crossover, Hecate can be recruited as a [[submachine gun]] unit despite her in game art uses an [[assault rifle]].
